Description: Sherd from rim of Attic red-figured pottery volute-krater. Plain square moulding at rim. Inside glazed with added red band at rim; key maeander frieze on outside of lip; back of head of youth, to left, preserved in neck frieze, with traces of wreath in faded white; top of lip reserved, with post-firing inscription.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
This sherd almost certainly joins BM 1900,0214.6 and is from same krater as Bonn 697.90 and neck sherds in Oxford.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0995)
